summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Economic Development Committee of the Dallas City Council will convene on January 6, 2025, at 1:00 PM in the Council Chambers, City Hall. The meeting aims to discuss ongoing economic development initiatives and upcoming policy changes.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
1. Approval of the minutes from the December 2, 2024, Economic Development Committee meeting.
2. Briefings on the Dallas Housing Opportunity Fund (DHOF) annual progress and updates from the City of Dallas Economic Development Corporation.

**Important Details**:  
- The committee will review a public hearing scheduled for January 8, 2025, regarding the adoption of an amended Economic Development Incentive Policy for 2025-2026, aimed at promoting economic and community development.
- An upcoming agenda item for January 22, 2025, includes a construction services contract for improvements at Roland G. Parrish Park.
- A petition for the creation of Willow Ranch Municipal Utility District No. 1 in Kaufman County will also be discussed.

**Action Items**:  
The committee seeks approval for the minutes from the previous meeting and will discuss recommendations for the adoption of the Economic Development Incentive Policy. Additionally, they will consider the construction contract and the petition for the municipal utility district. The meeting will also include a potential executive session to discuss legal and negotiation matters related to these agenda items.
